markdownRemark.html:
The things themselves that affect us, they stand without doors, neither knowing anything themselves nor able to utter anything unto others concerning themselves. What then is it, that passeth verdict on them? The understanding.

XIV. As virtue and wickedness consist not in passion, but in action; so

author: Marcus Aurelius

prev.excerpt:
Labour not as one to whom it is appointed to be wretched, nor as one
that either would be pitied, or admired; but let this be thine only…
